universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class MonthView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.ViewWidget
        • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.MonthView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, FontWidget, Widget

    public class MonthView
extends ViewWidget
implements FontWidget
    This view is used by CalendarView to display days data set for a specific month to allow to a user to pick its desired day for a specific month and year.

    This view draws name of month and year number at the top as title text and set of day numbers below it in 7 columns and 6 rows so also the months with the largest days data set will fit into drawing area. The numbers "table" has also one header row containing first letters of days in week.

    Month of which days should the MonthView present can be specified via setDate(java.util.Date), where such a date should have number and year calendar fields specified. Initial selected day can be specified via setSelection(int) and the current selected day can be obtained via getSelection() or getSelectionDate(). The later will return date that is represented by the current selected day for the specified month and year.

    Note, that this view saves its current state, so it can be later restored (in case of orientation change for example).

    Callbacks

    Use MonthView.OnDaySelectionListener to listen for callback about selected day. This listener can be registered via setOnDaySelectionListener(OnDaySelectionListener) and its callback will be fired whenever a user touches and releases its desired day.

    XML attributes

    See ViewWidget, MonthView Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiMonthViewStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      Represents a single day to be drawn for via onDrawDayNumber(Canvas, Day, Paint).

      A WidgetSavedState implementation used to ensure that the state of MonthView is properly saved.

      • CALENDAR_STYLE_LONG

        public static final int CALENDAR_STYLE_LONG
        Copy of Calendar.LONG flag to provide support also for pre GINGERBREAD Android version.

      • CALENDAR_STYLE_SHORT

        public static final int CALENDAR_STYLE_SHORT
        Copy of Calendar.SHORT flag to provide support also for pre GINGERBREAD Android version.

        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

    • Method Detail

      • resolveCalendarFieldName

        @NonNull
public static String resolveCalendarFieldName(@NonNull
                                                        Calendar calendar,
                                                        int field,
                                                        int style,
                                                        @NonNull
                                                        Locale locale)
        Obtains a name of a calendar field with the specified field identifier from the given calendar for the specified locale.

        Note, that for pre GINGERBREAD Android version and field names listed below, this method will return only English name regardless the specified locale:

        • Calendar.MONTH
        • Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK
        Parameters:
        calendar - The calendar from which to obtain the requested field's name.
        field - The desired field identifier. See Calendar for field identifiers.
        style - Style flag for the requested name. One of CALENDAR_STYLE_SHORT or CALENDAR_STYLE_LONG.
        locale - The locale for which to obtain the requested name. If there is no name available for the requested locale, UiConfig.DEFAULT_LOCALE will be used instead.
        Returns:
        Name of the requested calendar field.

      • obtainCalendarFieldName

        @NonNull
protected String obtainCalendarFieldName(@NonNull
                                                   Calendar calendar,
                                                   int field,
                                                   int style,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   Locale locale)
        Invoked to obtain a name of a calendar field with the specified field identifier from the given calendar for the specified locale.

        This method is here primarily to support displaying of calendar field names in this view also for pre GINGERBREAD.

        Parameters:
        calendar - The calendar from which to obtain the requested field's name.
        field - The desired field identifier.
        style - Style flag for the requested name. One of CALENDAR_STYLE_SHORT or CALENDAR_STYLE_LONG.
        locale - The locale for which to obtain the requested name.
        Returns:
        Name of the requested calendar field.
        See Also:
        resolveCalendarFieldName(Calendar, int, int, Locale)

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        getDate()

      • setDate

        public void setDate(long dateInMillis)
        Specifies a date in milliseconds of which data should be presented by this month view.

        This view will present name of month and year from the specified date and full set of days for the obtained month that will be displayed in 7 columns starting in the column of the first day of week.

        A selected day that should be highlighted can be specified via setSelection(int).

        Parameters:
        dateInMillis - The desired date in milliseconds to present by this month view.
        See Also:
        getDateInMillis()

      • getDate

        @NonNull
public Date getDate()
        Same as getDateInMillis() for Date object.
        Returns:
        This month's view date.
        See Also:
        setDate(java.util.Date)

      • getDateInMillis

        public long getDateInMillis()
        Returns the date of which month data are currently presented by this view.
        Returns:
        This month's view date in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setDate(long), getDate()

      • setTitleTypeface

        public void setTitleTypeface(@Nullable
                             Typeface typeface,
                             int style)
        Sets a typeface and style in which the title text (month + year) should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.
        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface. May be null to create default one from the specified style.
        style - One of Typeface.NORMAL, Typeface.BOLD, Typeface.ITALIC or Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC.
        See Also:
        setTitleTypeface(Typeface), getTitleTypeface(), getTitleTypefaceStyle()

      • setTitleTypeface

        public void setTitleTypeface(@Nullable
                             Typeface typeface)
        Sets a typeface in which the title text (month + year) should be displayed.

        Note, that not all Typeface families actually have bold and italic variants, so you may need to use setTitleTypeface(Typeface, int) to get the appearance that you actually want.

        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface. May be null to use a default one.
        See Also:
        getTitleTypeface(), getTitleTypefaceStyle()

      • setDaySelector

        public void setDaySelector(@Nullable
                           Drawable selector)
        Sets a drawable used to draw the selector highlighting the current selected day.
        Parameters:
        selector - The desired drawable for day selector. May be null to clear the current one.
        See Also:
        ui:uiMonthDaySelector, setDaySelectorTintList(ColorStateList), setDaySelectorTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode), getDaySelector()

      • getDaySelector

        @Nullable
public Drawable getDaySelector()
        Returns the current day selector's drawable.

        Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return an instance of TintDrawable if tint has been applied via setDaySelectorTintList(ColorStateList).

        The original wrapped indicator drawable can be obtained via DrawableWrapper.getDrawable().

        Returns:
        Day selector's drawable.
        See Also:
        setDaySelector(Drawable)

      • setDaySelectorTintList

        public void setDaySelectorTintList(@Nullable
                                   ColorStateList tint)
        Applies a tint to the day selector, if specified. This call does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode.SRC_IN by default.

        Subsequent calls to setDaySelector(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) will automatically mutate the drawable and apply the specified tint and tint mode using Drawable.setTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList).

        Parameters:
        tint - The tint to apply, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiIndicatorTint, getDaySelectorTintList(), Drawable.setTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)

      • getDaySelectorTintList

        @Nullable
public ColorStateList getDaySelectorTintList()
        Returns the tint applied to the day selector's drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        The day selector's drawable tint.
        See Also:
        setDaySelectorTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList)

      • setDaySelectorTintMode

        public void setDaySelectorTintMode(@Nullable
                                   PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
        Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by setDaySelectorTintList(android.content.res.ColorStateList) to the discrete indicator. The default mode is PorterDuff.Mode.SRC_IN.
        Parameters:
        tintMode - The blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiIndicatorTintMode, getDaySelectorTintMode(), Drawable.setTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)

      • getDaySelectorTintMode

        @Nullable
public PorterDuff.Mode getDaySelectorTintMode()
        Returns the blending mode used to apply the tint to the day selector's drawable, if specified.
        Returns:
        The day selector's drawable blending mode used to apply the tint.
        See Also:
        setDaySelectorTintMode(android.graphics.PorterDuff.Mode)

      • setDaySelectorRadius

        public void setDaySelectorRadius(@Px
                                 int radius)
        Sets a radius in which should be drawn the day selector's drawable specified via setDaySelector(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable).
        Parameters:
        radius - The desired radius in pixels. May be 0 to not draw the day selector.
        See Also:
        ui:uiMonthDaySelectorRadius, getDaySelectorRadius()

      • getDaySelectorRadius

        @Px
public int getDaySelectorRadius()
        Returns the current radius of the day selector's drawable.
        Returns:
        Day selector's radius in pixels.
        See Also:

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(@Nullable
                        Typeface typeface,
                        int style)
        Sets a global typeface and style in which all text of this view should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.
        Specified by:
        setTypeface in interface FontWidget
        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface. May be null to create default one from the specified style.
        style - One of Typeface.BOLD, Typeface.ITALIC or Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC.

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(Canvas canvas)
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class View
        See Also:
        onDrawTitle(Canvas, float, Paint), onDrawWeekDayLetters(Canvas, float, Paint), onDrawDayNumbers(Canvas, float, Paint)

      • onDrawTitle

        protected float onDrawTitle(@NonNull
                            Canvas canvas,
                            float top,
                            @NonNull
                            Paint paint)
        Invoked to draw title of this month view from the specified top position.

        Default implementation draws the name of month and current year number for the date specified for this month view side by side (horizontally) on the specified canvas.

        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which to draw the title (month name + year number).
        top - Top position from which to start the drawing. By default a value from View.getPaddingTop() is used.
        paint - Paint for title text ready to be used for drawing.
        Returns:
        Updated top position from which following graphic components (week day letters, day numbers) of this view will be drawn.
        See Also:
        onDrawWeekDayLetters(Canvas, float, Paint), onDrawDayNumbers(Canvas, float, Paint)

      • onDrawWeekDayLetters

        protected float onDrawWeekDayLetters(@NonNull
                                     Canvas canvas,
                                     float top,
                                     @NonNull
                                     Paint paint)
        Invoked to draw first letters of days in week from the specified top position.

        Default implementation draws day letters in one row on the specified canvas.

        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which to draw day letters.
        top - Top position from which to start the drawing. This is the position returned from onDrawTitle(Canvas, float, Paint) method + getDayLettersOffsetVertical().
        paint - Paint for day letters ready to be used for drawing.
        Returns:
        Updated top position from which following graphic components (day numbers) of this view will be drawn.
        See Also:
        onDrawDayNumbers(Canvas, float, Paint)

      • onDrawDayNumbers

        protected void onDrawDayNumbers(@NonNull
                                Canvas canvas,
                                float top,
                                @NonNull
                                Paint paint)
        Invoked to draw day numbers.

        Default implementation draws all days of the month for the date specified for this month view on the specified canvas in DAYS_IN_WEEK columns and max MAX_DAYS_ROWS rows.

        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which to draw day numbers.
        top - Top position from which to start the drawing. This is the position returned from onDrawWeekDayLetters(Canvas, float, Paint) method + getDayNumbersOffsetVertical().
        paint - Paint for day numbers ready to be used for drawing.

      • onDrawDayNumber

        protected void onDrawDayNumber(@NonNull
                               Canvas canvas,
                               @NonNull
                               MonthView.Day day,
                               @NonNull
                               Paint paint)
        Invoked from onDrawDayNumbers(Canvas, float, Paint) for each day number of the current month do draw a number text for the specified day.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas on which to draw day number text.
        day - The day for which to draw the number text.
        paint - Paint for day number ready (text size and typeface are already specified, but text color will be resolved depending on the given day state) to be used for drawing.
        See Also:
        MonthView.Day.isPressed(), MonthView.Day.isSelected()
